name: Path T Distal Bile Duct
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Distal bile duct tumors arise between the junction of the cystic duct-bile duct and the ampulla of Vater.  The classification includes tumors developing in congenital choledochal cysts and tumors arising in the intrapancreatic portion of the common bile duct.

**Note 2:**  Involvement within the  porta hepatis is coded according to the structures involved:  portal vein, common hepatic artery, and common hepatic duct.
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record
Tumor confined to the bile duct

Tumor confined to: 
    Lamina propria
    Mucosa, NOS
    Submucosa (superficial invasion)

Muscularis propria

Localized, NOS

Stated as T1
Tumor invades beyond the wall of the bile duct

Periductal/fibromuscular connective tissue

Stated as T2

Tumor invades:
    Gallbladder
    Liver
    Pancreas
    Duodenum
    Other adjacent organs

Common hepatic duct

Unilateral branches of portal vein (right or left)
Unilateral branches of hepatic artery (right or left)

Stated as T3
Tumor involves the celiac axis or the superior mesenteric artery

Abdominal wall
Celiac axis
Colon, NOS
    Transverse including flexure
Greater omentum
Omentum, NOS
    Lesser
Stomach, distal
Stomach, proximal
Superior mesenteric artery

Main portal vein or its branches bilaterally
Common hepatic artery
Hepatic artery, NOS
Portal vein, NOS

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4
Pathologic T is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of primary tumor
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of the highest T
Only positive biopsy of tumor which is not the highest T
